intro: Caiophora platyphylla, commonly known as the broad-leaved caiophora, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers humid conditions for optimal growth.
